p: Noteworthy was that IFN-Î± signature was consistently high in all time points tested in both early and late seroconverters and considered as the universal biomarker of human acute-phase OROV fever. The proportion of CXCL8 and IL-5 high producers were persistently elevated throughout the timeline kinetics selectively amongst early seroconverters. Conversely, the proportion of CXCL10 and IL-17A high producers were highlighted throughout all time points tested for late seroconverters.
